It has a good lesson\, and it's executed well\, but the lesson and execution does not fit the franchise. It was not created with it's audience in mind\, one of the most basic things a game creator must consider. The Audience. Naughty Dog has gotten so absorbed into all the other aspects of creating a game that it has forgotten one of the most basic elements of all. The audience. It forces you to continue on a revenge storyline\, which at the end\, teaches you revenge is essentially bad. Sure\, this is good for people who don't know what\, but you can see from people's reactions\, that the other half of the audience does know it.The reason why those who hate it hate it so much\, is because it forces people who don't like revenge\, to continue on the route to see what happens to a character they love. I review it as a 3/10 not because I don't care for the other aspects that they've put into it\, but because they've neglected a basic element. Do note\, I am not reviewing for everyone\, simply for myself. It's spaghetti without tomato sauce\, some people may like it\, some may not. I don't review this to tell everyone it's bad\, but to warn those who think alike me.If you are like me\, and dislike revenge and would rather not be forced to carry out revenge to get it hammered in your head that it is bad\, don't play it. Even if it's a gift.
